title: Cycling Plus March issue on sale now! Subscribe and receive a free Lezyne Pocket Drive Mini Pump!
content:
In this latest issue the Cycling Plus team explores how to transform your lunch hour from lazy to punchy with quick-fix ideas for a healthier break. They reveal the stories of cyclists who waged war on winter – and won! – and Matt Ray takes a trip to the South Downs.

Also in this issue, chief technical editor Warren Rossiter gets first rides of the Aurum Magma Zipp, Trek Domane+LT 7 ebike and the BMC Teammachine ALR Disc Two.

  • Subscribe to Cycling Plus to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

On ’guard

This month, four bikes that will take on the British winter and ensure that you keep riding all year round are put to the test: the Tifosi CK7 Centaur, Kinesis Tripster AT, Condor Fratello Disc and Ribble Endurance Ti.

Give me a break

From turbo sessions to improve your V02 max to core exercises and cross-training, there are lots of ways to use your lunch-break to stay fit, focused and flexible, and the team along with a host of experts have some suggestions.

Tyres on test

Wider tyres are taking over, so the team takes a look at 12 of the best 28mm tyres that you can buy right now.

Into the cold

Fear not the colder months of the year and keep riding with these top tips from the cyclists who welcome the cold rush and embrace ice and rain.
